intro: Hedysarum terminale, commonly known as the Sierra lupine, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and clusters of pea-like flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and slopes. Hedysarum terminale plays an important ecological role by fixing nitrogen in the soil, benefiting surrounding plant life.
